documents.document: More and more PAL articles being added to HealthLinkBC.ca too! Check back for new resources. https://t.co/QzR2BT4TAI
Where did 2016 go? Seemed like I squeezed a lot of living in last year, but also feels like it zoomed by.
@briankoppelman Heard the Godin podcast, looks like https://t.co/TmPInUBS0A has an archive of Spy mag from the 80s and 90s.
@robinblackmma Some of us remember those old shows on the Score! Didn't know you had a plan at the time, but enjoyed grass roots action.
Really enjoying the Mitch Joel podcast archives. Informative, inspiring conversations on marketing and beyond https://t.co/Qzs1Tz7uq8
@robinblackmma As are disengaging, creating space, and resetting momentum...I didn't see running, I saw smart tactics.
@robinblackmma Once again the crowd in Van goes wild! Most cheers and boos at the start and back and forth jeers during!
The Convince and Convert crew and @jaybaer are a trusted source of what is happening and working in marketing. https://t.co/TgCT4zJOdO
Time to kick this back into gear and (re)start sharing some of the great resources out there.
Appreciate all the great info from UserTesting! Watching the Emotionally Intelligent Design show. #UTwebinar
It's Never Too Late!! @cc_chapman Found your podcasts via Mitch Joel.
@kristinkontrol listening to your Guardian playlist and Nick Drake. Love what he did but, ohhhh, what he might have done...
@BCGovNews @ACTCommunityBC The story says available in 2017 and I don't see links to translations on the MCF page. Are they out now?
@lynda is it possible to sign up for a monthly sub and pre-pay 3 months? Thanks, Kris O.
Bootcamp? Don't need no bootcamp. Danced more in 2.5 days of #vfmf2015 than the last year. Legs are tired!
Singing and dancing at Jericho with hundreds of people--soul cleansing! And that was day one... #vfmf2015
@TravisVan33 Displace on 4th Ave. Usually go to Kings Head but they waffled hoping for Khatsalano crowds.
@robinblackmma Only midnight on the coast! This event, you hope lives up to potential, then surpasses. Looking forward to the breakdown!
@robinblackmma Watched the fights in a bar in Kits in Vancouver, when McG won, 100+ erupted in a way last seen with GSP!
@robinblackmma Watching post fight, enjoying analysis, many questions answered on this card. Want to see them all fight again!
Win Free Books From James Altucher For a Year! http://t.co/4ThbbH2key via @jaltucher
@stevendrowe Unusually warm weather out here--summer starting early, hope it sticks--crossing fingers...
Might have been a mild quake in Vancouver--felt the chair move and saw monitors wobble!
@perpetua Thanks for helping me discover and share great tunes over the years, will check out your new haul!
@stevendrowe wading through some now?! Seems it goes from coast to coast in varying depths.
CSS-Tricks coding is often over my head but web performance helps with what I'm working on now! http://t.co/OpZd2pNWD8
I haven't been to school for a while, but I never stop learning.
@dsearls @davewiner Great aerial night photos of NYC https://t.co/HJzfVLnlDZ
Movember 2014 in the home stretch! Donate to someone you know who is participating. Canada is in a tight race with the U.S.
Ebola virus has dropped off the new radar but the HLBC site has a page with info and links: http://t.co/tsz1z5degN
@dbarefoot do you have invites to share?! The site said to ask...
@jwalkerjr @davewiner having been young and greedy I get the limit/extract mindset, now I just want tools outside the milk barns.
@Ebiten_robson what are your hours? We want to grab a bite before the BC Lions game if you're open!
Throwback collides with tech... http://t.co/RGRXzJqxun Not sure I`d ever go back though!
Speaking of creativity... http://t.co/ALvc1xtKGd
Might explain how my ideas arise...http://t.co/86o63fdczB Not a conscious effort, just happens!
Playing with Dave Winer's new projects, hence the photos with text. Go to http://t.co/RhQzyzlO8P for more cool stuff.
Berry Season! http://t.co/NPh3vszo1h
Rainbows aren't all in the sky. http://t.co/gLlvGElEKY
Time flying by, June already. So much to do, so little time. Marketing folks, check out http://t.co/wSeXGF0LUM if you don't now.
Last breaking spring in Vancouver but the bees are back and I saw a snake sunning in the grass yesterday.
If you're a Bakadesuyo reader, Eric is finding new channels: http://t.co/cm6vn8ml9W & after a busy weekend, I need this!
We've improved searching on healthlinkbc.ca with the Google Search Appliance so finding health info should be easier!
Don Norman on product design and engineering: Stupid Smart Stuff | LinkedIn http://t.co/Od6D3KMRJM
No snow at sea level but the ice got me. Out went my feet and I hit the ground horizontal, my pack taking the brunt.
February already. 2014 is flying by! Read/see interesting bits but don't think to post it here. Time to form a new habit.
@TheresaLalonde Walk in the woods = dog heaven!
@1pooplechicken @CorvidLadyG Must be a youngun', still needs to fill out a bit!
@JonnyDrinks @lfroese @Winespiration @TheSpitter bit late...true! I enjoy discerning different nuances, but it's not for all!
@EatChickenWraps I'm not downtown often during the week . Do you have a set location?
@raincoaster still coming down hard in Burnaby, no rain yet...!
@invoker I sure hope so, the org I work for is missing a huge opportunity for connection as the world passes them by.
Snow day in Vancouver means slip and slide, great photo opps, and mesmerizing scenery. It's really coming down!
Silly me, a commando run to Costco this time of year? The parking lot was jammed with circling cars.
@timbray think you're onto something...en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feuerzangenbowle. Plotting a test run!
@stewart @dbarefoot Flickr is still the easiest way for me to show people photos in bulk sets vs. my gallery site.
@stewart @dbarefoot Probably seemed like a good idea at the time. Too bad it didn't take off...
Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind. -- Dr. Seuss
When a setback has me questioning what I'm made of and the value others see in me, I turn to wise people for help!
Haven't worked in downtown Vancouver for years. The best thing about Robson Square jury duty may be food trucks for lunch!
Powerbars way past best before date? Major score for hungry crows perched on the wires near my patio!
Off to jury duty. Interested to see our justice system in action!
@kocopywriter that would be: taking a close look or looking closely at Ghost, didn't make it to the screen!
I've used WordPress for 6+ years. Taking a closely at Ghost as a simpler alternative! https://t.co/vCt8kjeMY6
Almost daily I stumble on great resources, here's the latest! @analyticisms Check out their site too. http://t.co/oXWyE8dMPX
@ashjbee Read this http://t.co/xcpy6PDOIB which led to http://t.co/KjnbHpxau1 --interesting enterprise social media info!
A bit of humour for a gloomy Vancouver day, had me laughing out loud on the bus this a.m. http://t.co/hh48TgFeQ1
You take in rescued animals and pour on the love and slowly build a bond of trust. It's sad when it ends. Bella, you were the best!
November. Can't cling to waning summer any longer. And the forecast drives the point home.
@TheHSF Thanks for the update! We have resources linked to your site. I also run broken link checks for healthlinkbc.ca.
@TheHSF Yes! But our links to http://t.co/eqQ3KFGqr5 don't work. Should I convert them to .com? Thanks!
Can't get to your website--having problems? @TheHSF
The salmon are back and spawning in Still Creek for the 2nd year in a row! #stillcreek http://t.co/w4RAe1FhAB
Spent time this weekend with an old friend, 20JazzFunkGreats: prose, images, and cool music. http://t.co/rgFq5WRoQR
Catching up on saved shows, as a lifelong comics fan loved the PBS doc Superheroes. Watch online! http://t.co/dB9piD34gN
@lfroese @Winespiration True! Most folks don't give a rat's heinie about cassis or gooseberry. It's about sharing a moment.
Checking out the new #Hootlet! http://t.co/uACYS4Xi5h Probably a good idea since I'm being screened tomorrow!
Still grasping the impact of Hummingbird but here's a clear explanation for non SEO people. http://t.co/Y2T31mnMNq
@HootHR Thanks!
@HootHR Trying to contact Suraj Virk by phone and email, no response so far! Can I get a message to him here?
For women in tech and daughters who might be thinking about a career...Ada Lovelace Day! http://t.co/7XmHDjkaWg
@CorvidLadyG more shots coming! they are awesome creatures and great subjects.
@briansolis @gapingvoid Human nature and habit, never seen a windmill or tilted anything but pinball. Change is uphill.
@dbarefoot That level of detachment exists, yes. But really, how often did Jean Luc and crew not bend or break a rule?
Loving the "in-depth articles" on the Portent blog. http://t.co/u9hKkYu6Dw Plenty to ponder and use. Via @heidicohen's blog.
Best to avoid food and bev while reading this, lest you harm yourself or devices accidentally... http://t.co/Yr9kVjDtgK
@canice @mathewi @MileyCyrus On SNL...a one-way ticket to "guest judge" on the X-Files or another reality show on Fox?
Didn't change the world today. Fell a bit more in love. Secured our aunt's future. Solved a financial challenge. Tomorrow? Bring it!
October means time for salmon watch in Still Creek where in 2013 the first salmon returned in over 80 years! http://t.co/LfmFxrBppl
@streetcrow I'll be back out in the dark soon. Watching. Clicking. http://t.co/tKfTCBRpWB
Eric Barker always has interesting insights into being human but this is a great post. http://t.co/y3eA5ZGzKk
Marc Canter is back, and stirring things up again... http://t.co/Bz4HefjORi
Top of list today: umbrella shopping. My feeble collapsible brolly got shredded in Sunday's wind storm.
@HootSuite_Help Thanks! Ideally people at related sites would write and link tweets, but public agencies may need approved messages.
@HootSuite_Help Hi, want to clarify an ow.ly case: if we give canned tweets with ow.lys in 'em to sites, do clicks show up in our stats?
Canada's Web Users Grin and Bear Loss of Online Privacy - eMarketer http://t.co/nzbMHbSoru via @eMarketer
File under Trying Too Hard: On a burbling, farting Harley, broadcasting G. Thorogood loud on stereo, "B-b-b-b-b-bad..."
We're getting social media going at HealthLink BC and I'm eager to put available tools to work as we sort out our approach.
Great thunder and lightning show in Vancouver today. Unfortunately, I saw most of it through a hospital window (while visiting.)
Thunder in the morning and it looks brighter now in the early p.m. so no swimming in the rain today!
